EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) configured with burner‐inserters and output chests.
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) with a similar configuration.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• Burner‐mining drill connected to a wooden chest and interlinked by transport belts for iron ore extraction.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• Laboratory receiving automation‐science‐pack inputs supported by a network of small electric poles.

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) with connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5).
• Offshore Pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5).
• Pre‐existing Steam Engines at Positions:
  – (x=1.5, y=13.5)
  – (x=13.5, y=14.5)
  – (x=19.5, y=14.5)
  – (x=13.5, y=17.5)
  – (x=17.5, y=20.5)
  – (x=11.5, y=20.5)
  – (x=22.5, y=18.5)
  – (x=4.5, y=23.5)
• Extra Steam Engine for Improved Integration:
  – Previously repositioned from an initial failed candidate to Position(x=12.5, y=21.5).
  – Multiple automated fallback attempts (initial at (12.5, y=21.5), secondary at (14.5, y=21.5) and a tertiary candidate search near (8.5, y=22.5)) have failed due to buildability conflicts and severe obstructions.
  – Current status: Remains at Position(x=12.5, y=21.5) with unresolved pipe connection issues.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Position Buildability and Fallback Candidate Errors
 – Validate candidate positions for buildability before committing to automated repositioning routines.
 – When fallback candidates (e.g. at (12.5, y=21.5) and (14.5, y=21.5)) are rejected and tertiary candidate searches yield no buildable positions, manually inspect and clear obstructions or adjust the repositioning search parameters.

• Pipe Connection and Alignment Failures
 – Ensure that the boiler’s connection points and the extra steam engine’s ports are unobstructed and precisely aligned.
 – Verify that interfering entities (such as misaligned inserters or belts) are cleared from the pipe path before attempting connection.

• API Misuse in Position Handling
 – When accessing candidate position attributes, use proper property access instead of invoking positional methods as functions to avoid errors.

• General Automated Repositioning Limitations
 – In regions of severe layout congestion (as evident near the boiler’s connection point around (8.5, y=22.5)), incorporate pre‐checks for buildability and be prepared to revert to manual intervention if automated fallback routines consistently fail.
